channel.title: Best Company you used to host a server (Of any game type)
channel.description: First of all ill just say im sorry if this is the wrong area. I haven't been on mopar for a few months at least but I am getting back into it and I wondered whats the best hosting site you guys have ever used? Im looking to spend about 30$-40$ a month and hoping to get around 1gb to 1.5gb's of ram. Im going to be running a delta but I have fixed a lot of the memory leeks in it and its pretty good at player handling. So share past experience with sites if you could =D, please note I will never Use www.vpsland.com because its the worst service I have ever had.

item.title: Best Company you used to host a server (Of any game type)
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Newty:

Please don’t listen to Vain as he talks out of his ass, your computer specs actually don’t matter as much as how fast your internet is. That is why most people get a vps. Not to mention that if you want a respectable server you want your uptime as close to 100 percent as possible which is hardly attainable on a home computer.

Was literally waiting to see someone say that as I scrolled down.

Anyways, I use dreamhost. Not the best/cheapest, but I really don’t give a shit.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:14, topic:382900”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=478684.msg3505275#msg3505275 date=1298092353]

Hey look! It’s Andrew Ferguson. We were just talking about him.

ikr I was just thinking that too

What type of topic was I in?
[/quote]
Dunno someone mentioned Ferguson and jc asked why the name was familiar then someone said because we had a user named Andrew Ferguson before. A few days later,

a. Ferguson pops out![/quote]
Oh that facebook topic thing was actuly me and the allie person was my stalker and the kyle fagg guy was another one of my stalkers.

item.title: Best Company you used to host a server (Of any game type)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Newty:

Please don’t listen to Vain as he talks out of his ass, your computer specs actually don’t matter as much as how fast your internet is. That is why most people get a vps. Not to mention that if you want a respectable server you want your uptime as close to 100 percent as possible which is hardly attainable on a home computer.

This is true, the specs of your home computer don’t matter, your home internet connection is not fast enough to host a server, so to host a decent one you need a VPS at least.

That is why most people get a vps. Not to mention that if you want a respectable server you want your uptime as close to 100 percent as possible which is hardly attainable on a home computer.[/quote] Lolol at the ass talking part :P, but I have desided I am going to buy 2 months of a vps and then buy a 600-900$ laptop and pay an extra like 50$-100$ a month for the best internet access I can buy. (Right now mines about 250mb/second)

item.title: Best Company you used to host a server (Of any game type)
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Then just run it off your computer? No point in buying a VPS if you’re just starting out.

Actually, no point in buying a VPS, period.[/quote]

Do you think my computer has enough to hold the game and still do regular things like go on facebook?

Intel(R) Celeron(R) CPU 2.66GHz 2.67 GHz, 1.49 GB of ram

item.title: Best Company you used to host a server (Of any game type)
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

I Vain I:

It’s a lot cheaper if you just use a normal desktop computer running some form of Linux OS.

I thought of doing this but at the moment I can’t afford the 300-600$ to buy a computer tower or a cheep laptop, so I am going to do this for the first month or two till I can save up enough to buy one.

Read full topic
